## Begin: GIANTS IN THE SKY (Tavoros' Arc Quest!)
DM [CreamPuff] BOT 16-02-2024 20:54
*Just another quiet evening at the Blood on the Vine, where adventurers gather over simple, filling, hot meals with no frills, bandaging up their various cuts, burns, and bruises while nursing cups of deeply average wine. This is where Dar has found himself after his last, harrowing adventure with a close brush with death... the shadow of the Night Mother still hanging over him. This is also where James and Celeste are having a rare meal out -- after all, why eat out when your farmhouse full of delicious food and meals made with love is so nearby? But today, they're making a pit stop for the wine, since someone has taken the last three bottles. It must be Rabzu, sneaking in and packing what he can for an impromptu picnic and out the window again like a shadow that was never there. And Orion, the thri-kreen who doesn't frequent these establishments as he doesn't always feel fully comfortable with these social customs, except for nights like this one when he agrees to have a drink and dinner with his dear friend Tav. He sits patiently at a booth, knowing that Tav will be down from his room at any moment.* It's an uneventful evening, where most patrons are talking in soft murmurs. That is, until a bunch of rambunctious adventurers show up to participate in something called a "Bar Crawl", spurring them to act a fool by throwing daggers, using the ceiling beams for acrobatics, singing songs about a far away land, and a slender woman that James recognizes as Xia stands on a bar to chug a whole barrel of beer. But as quickly as they arrived, they're gone, chattering and complaining about having to walk to a winery on the other side of the valley.

Dar BOT 16-02-2024 22:39
To tell the truth, the kobold is quite stirred by the few minutes that felt like the most intense fights he's ever gotten himself into, and then the deity he met face to face during the last fight is quite the shock of her own. Still, he isn't just going to fold under pressure like that - if he was the sort of person who would, he would've died long ago. Instead, he winds down at Blood on the Vine, enjoying the cookies his friend Red baked for him and the explosive growth his magic experienced after such a stressful series of battles for his life - he takes solace in both the fact that he can just ask his friend for cookies like that and receive the usual sweetest of sweets, and the fact that his magic keeps on giving him new, powerful tools to survive and help others with.

DM [CreamPuff] BOT 17-02-2024 04:49
Meanwhile, upstairs, in his tiny rented room, Tavoros is pacing back and forth. In his hand is a worn leather bag with eight large, thumb-sized beans that have been dried, which he then painstakingly dipped in a very specific alchemical solution which he formulated himself. It was perhaps a few weeks ago when he was scouting out the woods in the stretch of land between Lake Zarovich and another strange little lake to its west that has a lonesome and foreboding tower standing in the center of it. While he was scanning that part of the wilds for resources to extract, an old man, beard wildly overgrown and hair ungroomed, in a tattered robe that looked like it may have once befitted an archmage, came raving to him. "YOU THERE, YOUNG MAN. You seek your answers here, you seek your answers there, like a bumbling idiot without direction!!" The old man had startled Tavoros, because he seemingly came out of nowhere, spittle flying out from his mouth as he ranted. "YOU KNOW WHAT YOU NEED?? IT WILL GIVE YOU ALL THE ANSWERS!! COME, COME CLOSER!!! LET ME TELL YOU!!" Instead of waiting for Tav to close the distance, the old man simply stomps up to him. "QUICKLY, take out a piece of parchment and some charcoal or a pen. It's flooding into my brain and I need to tell you right now before it's gone!!!" As Tav quickly fetches those things from his satchel, the old man suddenly points a finger skyward -- and a bolt of bright lightning flashes out, making the air suddenly smell metallic. From the top of a tree, a bird falls dead -- fried to its bones. "Ah... a bird... a bird was spying on us. Good thing I caught it in time." He gives Tav a crazed little smile, conspiratorially. (edited)
‚≠ê 4
DM [CreamPuff] BOT 17-02-2024 04:53
When Tav hands over the parchment and charcoal, the man begins scribbling like mad -- and it takes a good minute of watching intently for Tav to figure out that this was some sort of recipe... Upon completely covering the front and back of the page with spindly spiderlike writing, the old man stuffs it into Tav's hand and says, "Oh, lad. Seek your destiny. What you're looking for is here. Find it here." He frantically pats the parchment and suddenly storms off. "I gotta go feed my fish. GOTTA. GOTTA GO." The old man is surprisingly nimble, and Tav feared that chasing after him might invite another bolt of lightning, so instead, he spent the next few days deciphering the recipe he was left with, eventually crafting it to specification. It required specific treatment of the leather bag, covered in tiny runes he had to stitch in, along with magical oils and minerals. And the broad beans he bought from a farmer, who found it puzzling that the eladrin was buying only four beans... and he has been soaking them in various solutions since. *Now he has this ... bag of 8 beans that he made, but he has no clue what he's to do with it. And... he might be late for his dinner date with his best friend.* (edited)

You can't see the cloud on which the fortress sits anymore from down on the ground, as the verdant vine still stands defiantly erect, but there's a supernatural darkness gathering up where you just descended from, indicating the presence of a localized storm. Flashes of blue light pierce through the thick layers of mist, and lightning bots begin flashing at the very edge of your visual range. The thick vine, from where its growing out of the farmhouse, begins to vibrate and groan, as if on the other end, it is being assaulted by countless surges of powerful energy, making the vine convulse. Moments later, the vine begins to smoke and darken. Before long, the magical lightning storm severs the stalk somewhere in the clouds, and the massive plant matter begins to free fall toward the ground, like a massive rope released from its anchor high above. The party watches with horror, wondering whether it will land on the farmhouse or perhaps one of the neighbors. Luckily, as it free falls and coils and writhes, it leans toward the fields behind the farmhouse and crashes there with a deafening thud, making the ground shake, without destroying any further property. The party turns their gaze skyward once more, but no one pursues them from the skies. Perhaps Dakkra found her unconscious husband and decides to cut her losses, plotting revenge for the future, perhaps she'd rather focus her energy on fixing all the busted walls and doors in her fortress, but the relative calm and quiet returns.
